subject: How can I handle TestSetup.tear-down when an exception in a test is thrown ?

messageBody:
Hi everybody,
I'm unit testing some web-apps DAO's, and i've some problems.
I defined a run-once set up and teardown:

public static Test suite(){
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(SomeTest.class);
TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite){
protected void setUp(){
dv.createFirstValues();
dv.createMoreValues();
dv.createOtherValues();
}
protected void tearDown(){
dv.deleteAllValues();
}
};
return wrapper;
}

the setup method makes some inserts in db; the tear down, logically,
some deletes.

Now, when a ran a exception throwable test, I found out that all the
inserts were still in db. So my question is if there is a way to force
a call to tearDown method even if some tests throw an exception.
Thanks,
Moha.
